qas.question: Who was among the first readers of Ludwig  Wittgenstein's book?
How often times did Hayek and Wittgenstein meet?
What did Wittgenstein and Hayek do during the first world war?
What was the name of the book Wittgenstein published in 1921?

context: On his mother's side, Hayek was second cousin to the philosopher <a2_0>Ludwig Wittgenstein<a2_0/>. His mother often played with Wittgenstein's sisters, and had known Ludwig well. As a result of their family relationship, <a0_0>Hayek<a0_0/> became one of the first to read <a4_0>Wittgenstein's Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus<a4_0/> when the book was published in its original German edition in 1921. Although Hayek met Wittgenstein <a1_0>on only a few occasions<a1_0/>, Hayek said that Wittgenstein's philosophy and methods of analysis had a profound influence on his own life and thought. In his later years, Hayek recalled a discussion of philosophy with Wittgenstein, when <a3_0>both were officers<a3_0/> during World War I. After Wittgenstein's death, Hayek had intended to write a biography of Wittgenstein and worked on collecting family materials; and he later assisted biographers of Wittgenstein.
